cWarningAdditions: Not for the feint of heart...
poemContent: We sit on the stained wet red concrete,a folly flock of grey and white.The sky quiet and nice,only ended by the silent invasion.They form an eye, circling, swarming over us,Turning London's dank, polluted air of nothinginto a smog of yellow billed beak, whooshingwinds of the flaps of trillions of feeblewings, a cream of shit over everypane and scream.And one by one lightning smites the earth,sabers of dislodged feathers, slit down thewrists and necks of each girl and boy,ready to meet their maker.Peck, Peck, Peck. A small lone seagull screeched in a heavenly fury.As it smashed the brains out of a colossal giant.Blood spilling like wine, for each holy creature.After the reckoning, light starts to pierce throughtheir shroud of feather, casting silver beamson the redder concrete, as strange forms offlesh lay dismemberedbelow.Like doves they disappearedinto this light.Fair retributions for our sins,we had forgotten to feed the seagulls.But we don't know that they will return again,tomorrow.
